results.title: Clydesdales
results.brief_description: Examines the physical build of the Clydesdale, indicating its suitability as a draught horse for haulage purposes. Also compares the use of these horses before and after mechanization.

results.title: Clouds
results.creator_credit: Arthur D. Nelles and Film Associates
results.brief_description: Points out to the primary school pupil the variety of observations that can be made about clouds: their appearances, shapes and the way they build up or fade away. Illustrates also the importance of clouds as a source of water. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Cliff hanging moments from the serials
results.brief_description: A selection of three trailers from the 1920s motion picture serials and feature films: 1. The 15 chapter serial “The Steel Trail” (1923), starring William Duncan and Edith Johnson. 2. The 15 chapter serial “Captain Kidd” (1922) starring Eddie Polo. 3. “A Woman in grey” (1920) starring Arline Pretty and Henry G. Sell

results.title: Clean waters
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatic presentation of the function of water in everyday life. Fish, game, livestock and human beings must have clean water - polluted water brings death. Public health is endangered, recreational facilities are limited, the productivity of streams and lakes decreased and property values fall disastrously when water is polluted or there is danger of pollution. “Clean Waters” gives a very interesting account of two American sewage treatment methods which prevent pollution of water. See also “Clean waters” (002150) - same message, different images.

results.title: Clay in a special way (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Larry Schultz, Bill Snider and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: The film examines the positive, creative process of an art project with 4th, 5th and 6th grade students, handicapped and non-handicapped. An honest instructor expresses his initial doubts about teaching a “mainstreamed” class. Deaf and blind students participate with the aid of sign language interpreters and sighted students’ oral descriptions. Students are given information on the historical usage of clay through slides and a trip to a local museum. An artist, Maynard Fishler, visits the classroom to discuss his work. Throughout the project, a multi-sensory approach is used. The students decide to interpret transportation with clay, each student developing his own personal communication. The clay sculptures are the visual, concrete expression of a successful learning experience for all. Communication and creativity on may levels are results no less important.

results.title: Classic rock: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains fourteen classic rock anthems from an array of British musicians, performed live. The tracks are: Wishbone Ash “Blowin’ free”; Argent “Hold your head up”; The Sensational Alex Harvey band “Delilah”; Uriah Heep “Return to fantasy”; Asia “Heat of the moment”; Focus “Sylvia”; Emerson, Lake & Palmer “The Barbarian”; Family “Strange band”; Curved air “Melinda more or less”; Slade “Get down and get with it”; Deep Purple “Child in time”; Free “I’ll be moving”; Thin Lizzy “The Sun goes down”; Barclay James Harvest “Mockingbird”.
